Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Copper heart (?)
Description: This copper piece takes the overall shape of a heart, ending in an elongated and slightly flared tip. Almost in the middle of the ''auricles'', are two holes of about 1 mm in diametre. Within one of these holes, a 0,9 cm long nail can still be seen with a head of about 0,2 cm wide. This is a very flat piece half a millimetre in thickness, which was attached to a support by means of the two nails.
